extensionDescription.message: This extension simulates accessibility personas by applying visual effects to web pages.

popupIntroduction.message: Choose a persona to simulate the experience of a web user with accessibility-related needs.

ashleighDescription.message: A severely sight-impaired person with a screen reader.

ashleighInstructionBlur.message: The current tab's content is now blurred to simulate Ashleigh's sight impairment.

ashleighInstructionScreenReader.message: Open a screen reader on your device to experience how Ashleigh navigates the page.

ashleighInstructionVoiceOver.message: On Mac, you can use the native screen reader VoiceOver by pressing Cmd + F5.

ashleighInstructionNarrator.message: On Windows, you can use the native screen reader Narrator by pressing the Windows logo key + Ctrl + Enter.

pawelDescription.message: An autistic person who is easily distracted when browsing the web.

pawelInstructionDistractions.message: You'll see images and moving text, simulating Pawel's distractions.

pawelInstructionSoundEffects.message: Add sound distractions with Chrome Sound Effects. Use headphones to hear them loud enough.

pawelInstructionMidnightLizard.message: Adjust colors in the browser with the Midnight Lizard extension, which Pawel uses to help him focus.

simoneDescription.message: A dyslexic person who needs more time to understand text and forms.

simoneInstructionScrambledText.message: The text in the current tab is being scrambled to illustrate Simone's experience with dyslexia.

simoneInstructionReadParagraphs.message: Try to read paragraphs or navigate forms with this setting. Notice which parts of the page are especially hard to read.

ronDescription.message: An older person with a hand tremor and no assistive tech.

ronInstructionShakingCursor.message: The cursor is now shaking, simulating Ron's tremor.

ronInstructionCursorVisibility.message: Note: If the original cursor is still visible, try moving it to the address bar and back in.

claudiaDescription.message: A sight-impaired person who uses a screen magnifier.

claudiaInstructionMagnification.message: Claudia needs to magnify the page content to see everything clearly. The current tab is now zoomed in to 200%.

claudiaInstructionSystemSettings.message: Adjust your system settings to improve the simulation. On Mac, navigate to "Accessibility > Display", set your cursor to maximum size and increase contrast to the maximum.

chrisDescription.message: A person with rheumatoid arthritis who mostly uses his keyboard.

chrisInstructionColorPerception.message: As Chris does not see colors well, your tab is shown in greyscale. Your mouse cursor is hidden because Chris only uses his keyboard.

chrisInstructionCursorVisibility.message: Note: If the cursor is still visible, try moving it to the address bar and back in.

chrisInstructionKeyboardNavigation.message: Put your mouse aside and only use the keyboard to navigate the page. Use the TAB and ENTER keys and pay attention to the order in which elements are selected.
